title: A judge orders the end of the conservatorship between Michael Oher and the Tuohys
description: Tennessee Judge Kathleen Gomes said she'd never seen such a conservatorship for someone who isn't disabled. She isn't dismissing Oher's case to receive accounts of his finances from the Tuohys.

title: Why the Obama era 'car czar' thinks striking autoworkers risk overplaying their hand
description: He was the lead adviser for the Obama administration when the government bailed out auto companies in 2009. Now, he is weighing in on the union strikes against the big 3 American automakers.

title: 'Sparks' author Ian Johnson on Chinese 'challenging the party's monopoly on history'
description: Xi Jinping and China's ruling Communist Party have displayed a dogged obsession with controlling the historical narrative. But there's a group of underground historians fighting back.

title: North Carolina radio station plans to reject broadcasts of 'inappropriate' Met operas
description: WCPE says that six contemporary operas being presented this season by the Metropolitan Opera — including ones dealing with violence, race and LGBTQ issues — are "unsuitable" for broadcast.

title: More than 2,500 migrants crossing the Mediterranean died or went missing this year
description: The staggering toll increased more than 60% from last year, when fewer migrants attempted the dangerous journey to Europe. This year so far, the majority of migrants are arriving in Italy.

title: Man tied to suspected gunman in killing of Tupac Shakur is indicted on murder charge
description: A Nevada grand jury indicted Duane "Keffe D" Davis, one of the last living witnesses to the fatal drive-by shooting of the rapper in Las Vegas, prosecutors announced in court Friday

title: What a shutdown would mean for student loan borrowers
description: October loan payments will still be due, but an extended shutdown could impact customer service.

title: Biden calls for up to 3 offshore oil leases in Gulf of Mexico, upsetting both sides
description: The administration's proposal seeks to strike a balance between energy companies seeking greater oil and gas production and environmental activists who want Biden to shut down new offshore drilling.

title: House GOP hardliners block spending stopgap with shutdown looming
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy rejected a bipartisan Senate proposal to keep agencies funded through November 17 and instead moved a GOP bill that linked another month of spending with border security.

title: Despair flows after England's Sycamore Gap tree is cut down. Could it regrow?
description: The famous tree in northern England is believed to have been around 200 years old. Efforts are under way to salvage it through regrowth or grafting — or starting over from a new seed.

title: From California to Capitol Hill, tributes to Dianne Feinstein flood in after her death
description: Leaders in the House and the Senate paused from the race to avert a government shutdown to remember Feinstein, the California Democrat who was longest-serving woman to ever sit in the U.S. Senate.

title: Trump's N.Y. business empire is 'greatly at risk' from judge's fraud ruling
description: Legal and business experts say the ruling in New York state threatens assets such as Trump Tower and also empowers state Attorney General Letitia James, one of Donald Trump's main legal critics.

title: Wally the emotional support alligator went to see the Phillies. Then he went viral
description: Wally doesn't bite, loves hugs and has a sizeable social media following. He made headlines (again) for being denied entry to a baseball stadium — but his owner tells NPR that's not the full story.

title: UAW once again expands its historic strike, hitting two of the Big 3 automakers
description: The United Auto Workers will expand its strike against Ford and GM, but not Stellantis after the company formerly known as Chrysler made last-minute concessions.

title: Dianne Feinstein, longest serving woman in the Senate, has died at 90
description: Feinstein suddenly became the mayor of San Francisco when two other officials were assassinated. Later she was elected to the U.S. Senate after male senators grilled Anita Hill in public hearings.

title: Up First briefing: Affects of a shutdown; health workers may strike; Maui conspiracies
description: What will stay open if the government shuts down? Kaiser Permanente's health care workers near a nationwide walkout. How conspiracy theories spread in the wake of wildfires in Hawaii.

title: Federal shutdown could disrupt patient care at safety-net clinics across U.S.
description: A network of almost 1,400 federally-funded health clinics form an essential safety net for patients who have nowhere else to go. But even a temporary government shutdown could force cutbacks in care.

title: Dozens are dead after a blast in Pakistan at a rally celebrating birthday of prophet
description: A powerful bomb exploded near a mosque at a rally celebrating the birthday of Islam's Prophet Muhammad in Pakistan, killing at least 52 people and injuring dozens more, officials said.

title: After Libya's catastrophic floods, survivors and recovery teams assess losses
description: The floods in Derna left thousands dead, missing and displaced. Here are scenes from last week, as search and rescue teams and survivors dug through mud, continuing the work of recovery.

title: A century ago, Black WWI vets demanded better care. They got their own VA hospital
description: This is the centennial of the first Veterans Affairs hospital established to treat Black veterans. It opened in Tuskegee, Ala., after veterans were denied equitable health care after World War I.

title: Have a complaint about CVS? So do pharmacists: Many just walked out
description: After a large walkout forced at least a dozen stores to shut down in the Kansas City area, CVS promises change. But critics say the crisis in staffing and unfair pay extends beyond that market.

title: Overworked and understaffed: Kaiser workers are on the brink of a nationwide strike
description: More than 75,000 Kaiser Permanente health care workers at hundreds of U.S. facilities could go on strike for three days starting Wednesday, in the largest health care strike in the county's history.

title: From Trump's nickname to Commander Biden's bad behavior, can you beat the news quiz?
description: This week's GOP debate was overshadowed by who wasn't there, while the White House was roiled by more bad behavior from a four-legged inhabitant. Were you paying attention?

title: She received chemo in two states. Why did it cost so much more in Alaska?
description: A breast cancer patient who received similar treatments in two states saw significant differences in cost, illuminating how care in remote areas can come with a stiffer price tag.

title: What closes and what keeps running in a federal government shutdown
description: A government shutdown is looming but not every federal office will close completely. Some critical services will continue as employees work without pay.

title: Marcos says the Philippines will defend its waters against Chinese aggression
description: The president says he doesn't want trouble, but says Manila will staunchly defend its waters after its coast guard removed a floating barrier China placed at a disputed shoal in the South China Sea.

title: The fall of an enclave in Azerbaijan stuns the Armenian diaspora, shattering a dream
description: The swift fall of the ethnic Armenian enclave of Nagorno-Karabakh to Azerbaijani troops and exodus of much of its population has stunned the large Armenian diaspora around the world.

title: The White House chief of staff says it's on House Republicans to avert a shutdown
description: Jeff Zients has been getting the White House prepared for the first government shutdown of the Biden administration. Here's what the chief of staff told NPR about it.

title: A 16-year-old boy was arrested in England over the felling of an iconic tree
description: Thousands see the tree each year as they walk along Hadrian's Wall, which guarded the Roman Empire's northwestern frontier. It appeared in Kevin Costner's 1991 film Robin Hood: Prince Of Thieves.
